newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine-led group wins Uruguayan tower contract.
newsitem.headline: Argentine-led group wins Uruguayan tower contract.

text.p: A consortium headed by Argentina's Roggio group has won the contract to build a tower for Uruguay's state-owned telecommunications company Antel, Roggio said Tuesday.
The consortium made an offer of $92 million for the construction of the 33-floor tower which is expected to become a landmark in Uruguay's capital, Montevideo, said Roggio in a statement.
Ten consortiums bid in the contest, made up of 37 companies from 11 countries worldwide.
Roggio has a 70 percent stake in the consortium which includes Uruguay's Stiler SA and American Bridge.
The tower will become Antel's new headquarters. It will be about 160 metres high.
